Interface Table<R,C,T>

Type Parameters:
R - the type of row indexes
C - the type of column indexes
T - the type of values in the cells
All Known Subinterfaces:
Table.Unmodifiable<R,C,T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
HashMapTable
public interface Table<R,C,T>

An object that stores elements of type T in a modifiable table like structure where cells are indexed through pairs of coordinates R,C. R is the type of row indexes, C is the type of column indexes. Rows and columns have a well-defined encounter order.

This interface provides methods for modifying the content of the cells (#set(Object, Object, Object)) or the content and the structure (clear(), addRow(Series), addColumn(Series), removeRow(Object), removeColumn(Object)). It also provides methods for obtaining views of (parts) of the table.

For creating an unmodifiable table from data, one can use the from methods: from(SequencedMap), fromRows(List), and fromColumns(List).

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static final record 
    Table.Series<P,S,T>
    A series of values of tells, representing either a row or a column.
    static interface 
    Table.Unmodifiable<R,C,T>
    A read-only table for which all the methods for modifying the content throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

    values()
    Returns a list containing all the values of this table, by concatenating the values from the first to the last row.
    default Table.Unmodifiable<R,C,T>
    with(C newColIndex, T newT)
    Returns a values-only view of this table which has one column at newColIndex containing the provided newValue at each row.

      Creates a new unmodifiable table based on the values provided in map, organized in a map of rows, each being a map of column indexes to values.

      R - the type of row indexes
      C - the type of column indexes
      T - the type of values in the cells

    • addColumn

      void addColumn(Table.Series<C,R,T> column)
      Adds or modifies a column into this table. If the table already contains a column with the index corresponding to the column primary index, adds the provided series as the last column in the table. Otherwise, it modifies the column at column.primaryIndex() with the provided series. If column contains secondary (row) indexes that are not in this table, this method adds the corresponding rows to the table, in the order the map iterator encounters the corresponding keys.
      Parameters:
      column - the new column

    • addRow

      void addRow(Table.Series<R,C,T> row)
      Adds or modifies a row into this table. If the table already contains a row with the index corresponding to the row primary index, adds the provided series as the last row in the table. Otherwise, it modifies the column at row.primaryIndex() with the provided series. If row contains secondary (column) indexes that are not in this table, this method adds the corresponding columns to the table, in the order the map iterator encounters the corresponding keys.
      Parameters:
      row - the new row

    • aggregateRows

      default <T1,K> Table<R,C,T1> aggregateRows(Function<Table.Series<R,C,T>, K> classifier, Comparator<R> comparator, Function<List<Table.Series<R,C,T>>, SequencedMap<C,T1>> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table by aggregating this table by rows. First, rows are partitioned using classifier, using the equivalence of K as relation. Then, rows in each partition are sorted using comparator. Finally, each ordered partition is fed to aggregator to obtain a single row where values are of type T1 and the row index is the first one of the partition. Depending on aggregator, the created table may have more or less columns of this table.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of values of cells in the new table
      K - the type of keys to partition rows
      Parameters:
      classifier - the function to partition rows
      comparator - the comparator to sort rows within each partition
      aggregator - the function to aggregate ordered rows in new rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • aggregateRowsByContent

      default <T1,K> Table<R,C,T1> aggregateRowsByContent(Function<SequencedMap<C,T>, K> classifier, Comparator<R> comparator, Function<List<Table.Series<R,C,T>>, SequencedMap<C,T1>> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table by aggregating this table by row contents. First, rows are partitioned using classifier, using the equivalence of K as relation. Then, rows in each partition are sorted using comparator. Finally, each ordered partition is fed to aggregator to obtain a single row where values are of type T1 and the row index is the first one of the partition. Depending on aggregator, the created table may have more or less columns of this table. Internally calls Table#aggregateRows(Function, Comparator, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of values of cells in the new table
      K - the type of keys to partition rows
      Parameters:
      classifier - the function to partition rows
      comparator - the comparator to sort rows within each partition
      aggregator - the function to aggregate ordered rows in new rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • aggregateRowsByContentSingle

      default <T1,K> Table<R,C,T1> aggregateRowsByContentSingle(Function<SequencedMap<C,T>, K> classifier, Comparator<R> comparator, Function<List<T>,T1> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table by aggregating this table by row contents and processing columns independently. First, rows are partitioned using classifier, using the equivalence of K as relation. Then, rows in each partition are sorted using comparator. Finally, for each column index of this table, the corresponding cell values of each ordered partition are fed to aggregator to obtain a single value are of type T1 and the row index is the first one of the partition. The created table will have the same number of columns of this table. Internally calls aggregateRowsByContentSingle(Function, Comparator, BiFunction).
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of values of cells in the new table
      K - the type of keys to partition rows
      Parameters:
      classifier - the function to partition rows
      comparator - the comparator to sort rows within each partition
      aggregator - the function to aggregate ordered rows in new rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • aggregateRowsByContentSingle

      default <T1,K> Table<R,C,T1> aggregateRowsByContentSingle(Function<SequencedMap<C,T>, K> classifier, Comparator<R> comparator, BiFunction<C,List<T>,T1> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table by aggregating this table by row contents and processing columns independently. First, rows are partitioned using classifier, using the equivalence of K as relation. Then, rows in each partition are sorted using comparator. Finally, for each column index of this table, the corresponding cell values of each ordered partition are fed to aggregator to obtain a single value are of type T1 and the row index is the first one of the partition. The created table will have the same number of columns of this table. Internally calls aggregateRowsByContent(Function, Comparator, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of values of cells in the new table
      K - the type of keys to partition rows
      Parameters:
      classifier - the function to partition rows
      comparator - the comparator to sort rows within each partition
      aggregator - the function to aggregate ordered rows in new rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • aggregateRowsByIndex

      default <T1,K> Table<R,C,T1> aggregateRowsByIndex(Function<R,K> classifier, Comparator<R> comparator, Function<List<Table.Series<R,C,T>>, SequencedMap<C,T1>> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table by aggregating this table by row indexes. First, rows are partitioned using classifier, using the equivalence of K as relation. Then, rows in each partition are sorted using comparator. Finally, each ordered partition is fed to aggregator to obtain a single row where values are of type T1 and the row index is the first in the partition. Depending on aggregator, the created table may have more or less columns of this table. Internally calls Table#aggregateRows(Function, Comparator, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of values of cells in the new table
      K - the type of keys to partition rows
      Parameters:
      classifier - the function to partition rows
      comparator - the comparator to sort rows within each partition
      aggregator - the function to aggregate ordered rows in new rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • aggregateRowsByIndexSingle

      default <T1,K> Table<R,C,T1> aggregateRowsByIndexSingle(Function<R,K> classifier, Comparator<R> comparator, BiFunction<C, List<Map.Entry<R,T>>, T1> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table by aggregating this table by row indexes and processing columns independently. First, rows are partitioned using classifier, using the equivalence of K as relation. Then, rows in each partition are sorted using comparator. Finally, for each column index of this table, the corresponding cell values of each ordered partition are fed to aggregator to obtain a single value of type T1 to be put in a row with index as the first row in the partition. The created table will have the same number of columns of this table. Internally calls aggregateRowsByIndex(Function, Comparator, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of values of cells in the new table
      K - the type of keys to partition rows
      Parameters:
      classifier - the function to partition rows
      comparator - the comparator to sort rows within each partition
      aggregator - the function to aggregate ordered cell values in new values
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • aggregateRowsByIndexSingle

      default <T1,K> Table<R,C,T1> aggregateRowsByIndexSingle(Function<R,K> classifier, Comparator<R> comparator, Function<List<Map.Entry<R,T>>, T1> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table by aggregating this table by row indexes and processing columns independently. First, rows are partitioned using classifier, using the equivalence of K as relation. Then, rows in each partition are sorted using comparator. Finally, for each column index of this table, the corresponding cell values of each ordered partition are fed to aggregator to obtain a single value of type T1 to be put in a row with index as the first row in the partition. The created table will have the same number of columns of this table. Internally calls aggregateRowsByIndexSingle(Function, Comparator, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of values of cells in the new table
      K - the type of keys to partition rows
      Parameters:
      classifier - the function to partition rows
      comparator - the comparator to sort rows within each partition
      aggregator - the function to aggregate ordered cell values in new values
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • clear

      default void clear()
      Clear the table by removing all the rows.

    • colIndexes

      SequencedSet<C> colIndexes()
      Returns the column indexes.
      Returns:
      the column indexes

    • colLeftJoin

      default Table.Unmodifiable<R,C,T> colLeftJoin(Table<R,C,T> other)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table which has the row indexes of this table and the union of the column indexes of this and the other table. In each cell of the new table at row $r$ and column $c$, the value is the one of this table, if present, or the other table, if present, or empty. All the new column indexes are added after the ones of this table in the new table.
      Parameters:
      other - the other table to join on the left to this one
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • collapseSlidingCols

      default Table<R,C,T> collapseSlidingCols(int n, Function<List<T>,T> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table built by collapsing values in sliding windows of n columns of this table using the aggregator function. The new table has the same row indexes of this table but n-1 columns. The first column index of the new table is the n-th of this table.
      Parameters:
      n - the size of slice, i.e., the number of adjacent columns to collapse
      aggregator - the function for collapsing values in a single value
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • collapseSlidingRows

      default Table<R,C,T> collapseSlidingRows(int n, Function<List<T>,T> aggregator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table built by collapsing values in sliding windows of n rows of this table using the aggregator function. The new table has the same column indexes of this table but n-1 rows. The first row index of the new table is the n-th of this table.
      Parameters:
      n - the size of slice, i.e., the number of adjacent rows to collapse
      aggregator - the function for collapsing values in a single value
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

      default SequencedMap<R,T> column(C colIndex)

      colIndex - the index of the column
      Returns:

    • expandColumn

      default <C1,T1> Table<R,C1,T1> expandColumn(C colIndex, BiFunction<R, T, SequencedMap<C1,T1>> expander)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table built by expanding the column at colIndex using the expander function. The new table will have the same row indexes of this table.
      Type Parameters:
      C1 - the type of the new table column indexes
      T1 - the type of the new table values
      Parameters:
      colIndex - the index of the column to expand
      expander - the function to apply to expand each column value
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • expandRowIndex

      default <C1,T1> Table<R,C1,T1> expandRowIndex(Function<R, SequencedMap<C1,T1>> expander)

      Type Parameters:
      C1 - the type of the new table column indexes
      T1 - the type of the new table values
      Parameters:
      expander - the function to apply to expand each row index
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

      default Table<R,C,T> filterColumnsByRowValue(R rowIndex, Predicate<T> predicate)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table that contains all and only the rows of this table for which the value at the column colIndex matches the provided predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the predicate to filter rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • filterColumnsByValues

      default Table<R,C,T> filterColumnsByValues(Predicate<SequencedMap<R,T>> predicate)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table that contains all and only the rows of this table whose values match the provided predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the predicate to filter rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • filterRows

      default Table<R,C,T> filterRows(Predicate<Table.Series<R,C,T>> rowPredicate)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table that contains all and only the rows of this table which match the provided rowPredicate.
      Parameters:
      rowPredicate - the predicate to filter rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • filterRowsByColumnValue

      default Table<R,C,T> filterRowsByColumnValue(C colIndex, Predicate<T> predicate)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table that contains all and only the rows of this table for which the value at the column colIndex matches the provided predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the predicate to filter rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • filterRowsByValues

      default Table<R,C,T> filterRowsByValues(Predicate<SequencedMap<C,T>> predicate)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table that contains all and only the rows of this table whose values match the provided predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the predicate to filter rows
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • get

      T get(R rowIndex, C colIndex)
      Returns the value at the cell given by the provided row and column indexes, if any. Returns null if the cell value is actually null or if the table does not have a column at colIndex or a row at rowIndex.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the index of the row of the cell
      colIndex - the index of the column of the cell
      Returns:
      the value at the cell given by the provided row and column indexes, or null if no value

    • get

      default T get(int x, int y)
      Returns the value at the cell given by the provided column sequential index x and row sequential index y, if any. Returns null if the cell value is actually null; throws an exception if x,y is not valid, i.e., if the table has fewer than x+1 columns or fewer than y+1 rows or if x or y are negative.
      Parameters:
      x - the column sequential index
      y - the row sequential index
      Returns:
      the value at the cell, or null if no value
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if x,y is not valid

    • mapRowIndexes

      default <R1> Table<R1,C,T> mapRowIndexes(BiFunction<R, SequencedMap<C,T>, R1> mapper)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table built by applying the mapper to row indexes of this table. The new table will have the same column indexes of this table and the same values; but could have, in general fewer columns, if mapper is not injective for row indexes of this table.
      Type Parameters:
      R1 - the type of the new table row indexes
      Parameters:
      mapper - the function to map row indexes to new row indexes
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • mapRowIndexes

      default <R1> Table<R1,C,T> mapRowIndexes(Function<R,R1> mapper)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table built by applying the mapper to row indexes of this table. The new table will have the same column indexes of this table and the same values; but could have, in general fewer columns, if mapper is not injective for row indexes of this table.
      Type Parameters:
      R1 - the type of the new table row indexes
      Parameters:
      mapper - the function to map row indexes to new row indexes
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • mapValues

      default <T1> Table<R,C,T1> mapValues(TriFunction<R,C,T,T1> mapper)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table built by applying the mapper lazily and cell-wise to this table. The new table will have the same row indexes and column indexes of this table. The mapper is actually applied to a cell value only if it is actually retrieved (with, e.g., get(Object, Object)), at the first retrieval. This makes the built table potentially a view of the original (this) table.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of the new table values
      Parameters:
      mapper - the function to map cells to new cell values
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • mapValues

      default <T1> Table<R,C,T1> mapValues(Function<T,T1> mapper)
      Returns a new unmodifiable table built by applying the mapper lazily and cell-wise to this table. The new table will have the same row indexes and column indexes of this table. The mapper is actually applied to a cell value only if it is actually retrieved (with, e.g., get(Object, Object)), at the first retrieval. This makes the built table potentially a view of the original (this) table.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the type of the new table values
      Parameters:
      mapper - the function to map cell values to new cell values
      Returns:
      the new unmodifiable table

    • nOfColumns

      default int nOfColumns()
      Returns the number of columns in this table.
      Returns:
      the number of columns in this table.

    • nOfRows

      default int nOfRows()
      Returns the number of rows in this table.
      Returns:
      the number of rows in this table.

    • prettyToString

      default String prettyToString(Function<R,String> rowIndexFormatter, Function<C,String> colIndexFormatter, Function<T,String> valueFormatter)

      Returns a human-readable representation of this table, in a way one would expect to see a table. The returned string contains $n+1$ (with $n$ being the number of rows) lines, the first one for the header, then one for each row. The content of the lines is formatted to make cell values and the initial row index aligned. Individual values, row indexes, and col indexes are transformed to strings through the provided formatted functions. Those functions are expected not to return multi-line strings. One convenient way to provide the formatters is through method reference to the String.formatted(Object...) method, e.g.:

      Table<Integer, String, Double> table = /* ... */
System.out.println(table.prettyToString(
  "%d"::formatted,
  "%s"::formatted,
  "%.3"::formatted
));
      Parameters:
      rowIndexFormatter - the formatter for row indexes
      colIndexFormatter - the formatter for column indexes
      valueFormatter - the formatter for values
      Returns:
      a human-readable string representation of this table

    • prettyToString

      default String prettyToString()
      Returns a human-readable representation of this table, in a way one would expect to see a table. The returned string contains $n+1$ (with $n$ being the number of rows) lines, the first one for the header, then one for each row. The content of the lines is formatted to make cell values and the initial row index aligned. Individual values, row indexes, and col indexes are transformed to strings through Object.toString().
      Returns:
      a human-readable string representation of this table

    • removeColumn

      void removeColumn(C colIndex)
      Removes the column at colIndex, if any, from this table. If the table has no column at colIndex, invoking this method has no effect.
      Parameters:
      colIndex - the index of the column to remove

    • removeRow

      void removeRow(R rowIndex)
      Removes the row at rowIndex, if any, from this table. If the table has no row at rowIndex, invoking this method has no effect.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the index of the column to remove

    • row

      default SequencedMap<C,T> row(R rowIndex)
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the row at rowIndex of this table, or an empty map if no such row exists.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the index of the column
      Returns:
      a map with the values in the cells of the row indexed by column indexes

      SequencedSet<R> rowIndexes()
      Returns the row indexes.
      Returns:
      the row indexes

    • rowValues

      default List<T> rowValues(R rowIndex)
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the values in the row at rowIndex of this table, or an empty list if no such row exists.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the index of the row
      Returns:
      the values in the row

    • rows

      default List<SequencedMap<C,T>> rows()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the rows of this table.
      Returns:
      the rows of this table

    • set

      void set(R rowIndex, C colIndex, T t)
      Set the value at the cell given by the provided row and column indexes. If there is not a row at rowIndex, adds the row as last row. If there is not a column at colIndex, adds the column as last column.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the index of the row of the cell
      colIndex - the index of the column of the cell

    • set

      default void set(int x, int y, T t)
      Set the value at the cell given by the provided column sequential index x and row sequential index y, if any. Throws an exception if x,y is not valid, i.e., if the table has fewer than x+1 columns or fewer than y+1 rows or if x or y are negative.
      Parameters:
      x - the column sequential index
      y - the row sequential index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if x,y is not valid

    • sortedByRowIndex

      default Table.Unmodifiable<R,C,T> sortedByRowIndex(Comparator<R> comparator)
      Returns a values-only view of this table where rows are sorted according to the provided comparator. A values-only view is one where values in the cells reflect the changes of the original (this) table, but the structure of the view table is the one at creation. That is, row indexes and col indexes stay the same in values and order once the view is created.
      Parameters:
      comparator - the comparator for ordering row indexes
      Returns:
      the values-only view of this table

    • sortedByValue

      default Table.Unmodifiable<R,C,T> sortedByValue(C colIndex, Comparator<T> comparator)
      Returns a new unmodifiable where rows are sorted according to the provided comparator applied to values of the column at colIndex.
      Parameters:
      comparator - the comparator for ordering values
      Returns:
      the values-only view of this table

    • values

      default List<T> values()
      Returns a list containing all the values of this table, by concatenating the values from the first to the last row.
      Returns:
      all the values of this table

    • with

      default Table.Unmodifiable<R,C,T> with(C newColIndex, T newT)
      Returns a values-only view of this table which has one column at newColIndex containing the provided newValue at each row. A values-only view is one where values in the cells reflect the changes of the original (this) table, but the structure of the view table is the one at creation (with the new column). The new column possibly overwrites (in the view) an existing column with the same column index in this table.
      Parameters:
      newColIndex - the index of the new column
      newT - the value in each cell of the new column
      Returns:
      the values-only view of this table
